104606.name: Share of social protection in government expenditure (OECD (2017))
104606.description: Social protection expenditures are divided into nine sub-functions including sickness and disability; old age (pensions); survivors; family and children; unemployment; housing; social exclusion not elsewhere classified (n.e.c); R&D social protection; and social protection n.e.c.
104606.datasetName: Structure of general government expenditures by function - OECD (2017)
104606.s_name: Structure of general government expenditures by function - OECD (2017)

source.name: Structure of general government expenditures by function - OECD (2017)
source.additionalInfo: This dataset outlines government spending on key areas such as education, health, defence, social protection, or public order and safety. The different functions aggregate expenditures according to pre-defined categories to enable sensible comparisons of national priorities across governments. South Korea, Colombia and Costa Rica refer to 2014 Data for Iceland are not included in the OECD average due to missing time-series. Data are not available for Canada, Chile, Mexico, New Zealand and Turkey. For more details on methodology and definitions, see the Government at a Glance (2017) report available here. For a comprehensive breakdown of what spending items are included in each function of government see Annex C of the Government at a Glance (2017) report.
